Class WidgetProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppWidgetProvider
      • com.eis.greenenergy.main.WidgetProvider

  • public class WidgetProvider
extends AppWidgetProvider

    2014-08-11
    Version:
    2.2
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • onUpdate

        public void onUpdate(Context context,
            AppWidgetManager appWidgetManager,
            int[] appWidgetIds)
        Initiates the widget layout and functionality.
        In this method the current point of time is accessed in order to display it to the user as the last instance when the widget was updated.
        Moreover, the current amount of green energy is retrieved to display the corresponding background color and bar chart on the widget. Two intents are created within this method. One of them is added to the widget layout itself and causes the application to launch when the user tabs on the widget. The other intent is added to the widget's refresh button and implicitly causes this method to be called again.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of this instance of the widget.
        appWidgetManager - Object to manage and update the widget's state.
        appWidgetIds - The appWidgetIds for which an update is needed.

      • onUpdate

        private void onUpdate(Context context)
        Calls the method onUpdate(context, appWidgetManager, appWidgetIds).
        This method represents a possibility to call the method which is necessary to refresh the widget's settings from within the WidgetProvider class.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of this instance of the widget.

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(Context context,
             Intent intent)
        Initiates refreshing the widget.
        This method is called when the refresh button is clicked. It then calls the method onUpdate(context) and the settings are reprocessed.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of this instance of the widget.
        intent - Intent which triggered the call of this method.
